intro: Horkelia douglasiana, commonly known as Douglas's horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and arid environments. Horkelia douglasiana is adapted to harsh conditions, making it a hardy and resilient species in its native habitat.
